metadata.title: CVE-2020-29571 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. A bounds check common tomost operation time functions specific to FIFO event channels depends onthe CPU observing consistent state. While the producer side usesappropriately ordered writes, the consumer side isn't protected againstre-ordered reads, and may hence end up de-referencing a NULL pointer.Malicious or buggy guest kernels can mount a Denial of Service (DoS) attackaffecting the entire system. Only Arm systems may be vulnerable. Whether asystem is vulnerable depends on the specific CPU. x86 systems are notvulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29571` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxengnttab1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenhypfs1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenmisc4.17 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenstore4 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxentoollog1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-4.17-amd64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-4.17-arm64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-4.17-armhf - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-utils-4.17 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-utils-common - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xenstore-utils - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2').
